ReviewTitle: Wow! This is my first time!

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. While in the military, my husband had spent a great deal of time in Japan and loves this form of cuisine. In trying to describe it to friends, I said "try to imagine a fondue dinner but using an habachi". We ordered a lovely variety of meats, seafood and vegetables to grill and complimented it with a delicious noodle dish and potstickers. It was on a Monday evening, entitling us to Hsppy Hour prices. And our server was knowledgeable and attentive. Try also the newest location in Orlando across from the Drury Hotel!

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: We arrived to discover that our Saturday evening reservation was given to another party -- our infraction ? 10 minutes late due to heavy Houston traffic. What is the remedy? We were told that we must wait at the end of the list which was 1.5 hours estimate. We were so surprised by their unprofessional attitude that we left. It became apparent that this place is about packing as many people into a small space as possible and turn as many tables to keep the flow going. We were disappointed in their callous hostess and lack of empathy expressed towards a party of four who drove a distance to be there. We dined down the street where other Japanese restaurants were available and accommodating.

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: This is one of those cook your own meat places. Always seems strange but it can be a bit of fun. Japanese BBQ is a change from the sushi I'm used to so we ordered a range of meats and sides. All were delicious and the smores at the end topped everything off. I recommend the chicken wings. Delicious.

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: Great place for dinner. We unfortunately missed out on the "happy hour" deal for $45 but chose a range of meats, sides and chicken wings at a reasonable price instead. All tasted great and surprisingly not as oily as some other similar bbq places I have been too. We finished the meal off with some smores which was a great using the grill.

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: I must say that i had a high expectation on this restaurant, tried their location in Oahu, hawaii and i was more than satisfied with the service and the quality of food. It took us almost 5 hours driving from Dallas to get to Houston, just for the pleasure to have some real japanese grill bbq... or Yakiniku as we call in japanese. It totally worht it... i must say that the service, quality of food and cuts were superb ! we just love it ! Even the waiter that was a trainee was super nice with us ! good job trainer !! sorry we dont remember your name...but for sure next time we will look for you ! Only one recomendation, as japanese we always eat yakiniku with Daikon oroshi (radish) and we couldt find it on the menu... we really need it !! we love it wit our food ! is part of heritage! please include it as side order!. Definetly i will keep recomending to all our friends!

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: The place has a great decoration and having a small grill in the middle of your table makes all the difference. They serve small dishes, try as many as you can, mushrooms and lamb in my opinion are the best. Definitely I will come back to this place!
ReviewTitle: Delicious food in a great place

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: Well........if you go by yourself. don't expect much food! ( A la carte) I received the smallest portion of meat I have ever had. and especially for that price. The food tasted okay. and the service was good. The hot was warm at best. I guess I'm use to Korean BBQ. All you can eat and all the sides you want. I got lucky on the parking. Very doubtful if I'll return.

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: visited here during a recent trop to Houston. You have the preference to cook your own on a mini grill at the table and looked fun as a few other customers were doing this. I chose not to and eat a few options of the starter menu, i have the vegetable spring rolls which were delicious and the chicken teryiaki which came to the table in a sizzling dish, it was very good, Also tried the melon drink which was refreshing change but a bit sweet and sickly after half a glass. Overall a good restaurant and would return. the staff shouted weocomes in japanese phrases which was very unique and pleasant :)

ProviderLocation: 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston , TX 77002-8690 510 Gray St Ste A , Houston, TX 77002-8690
ReviewText: I wasn't too crazy about the thought of having to grill my own lunch. However, it was a fun experience. I went for a solo lunch (and returned several times). I'll have to bring some friends one day. My favorites were the garlic noodles, bacon wrapped scallops and lamb chops. The meat and seafood are fresh, and the service has been good.

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: The egg rolls were magnificent. Fried rice great. I really like the round balls covered with sesame seeds (Sorry, I don't know what they are called, my bad).. Basically the food was very good. However the place could definitely used with some sprucing up and cleaning up. We found out the hard way that the dim sum is only served from 10a to 3p. Their website does not inform visitors of this fact.

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: Excellent dim sum. They come around with the carts even on a Tuesday. Service is minimal typical for dim sum. The ladies that push the carts have the best English compared others. Only negative is the place not that clean. The pond had trash in it. Inside areas has years of dust. The fish tanks had green funk growing. Management needs to hire an outside cleaning company. All in all delicious dim sum but the dirty front of house makes one worried what the kitchen is like.

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: Ocean Palace is a colossus of a restaurant. It probably seats 500 in the upstairs hall. But don't be overwhelmed. The little push carts of goodness will make you feel right at home. We had several dim sum dishes and two were great and one was mediocre. No problems though, just try the next wave of dim sum being carted about! We thoroughly enjoyed the food, the atmosphere, and people watching.
ReviewTitle: A great Chinese dim sum factory!

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our experience of having dim sum at Ocean Palace. It was like having dim sum in NYC. Service friendly and dim sum delicious and well made. Also the jasmine tea was delicious.

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: Oh my goodness! What a treat! We decided to drive thru Chinatown of Houston with no particular agenda of places to eat. We saw Ocean Palace Resturant and decided to give it a try. If they take such great care of the outside then the inside has got to be great right? Well it was! As luck would have it we caught the last hour of Dim Sum and everything we had was great! Like what? I don't know! Tasty morsels of shrimp, pork and shrimp and pork. Delightful! Though the cart ladies knew very little English they tried very hard to explain the items in their cart and very sweet about it too. Loved it!

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: I had chicken feets, dry shrimp rice noodle, pan fried chives dumplings. All of them were excellent. I will come again. Only thing could be better was to have more cart on the floor. I have to go the cooking area to get what I want. Although waiter offer to carry my tray.

ProviderLocation: 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston , TX 77072-2534 11215 Bellaire Blvd Ste D , Houston, TX 77072-2534
ReviewText: i don't like to leave bad reviews but i feel people need to be warned. asked for teriyaki chicken told no! then she said the lemon pepper which was fine by me. after 2 minutes was asked to come back later. note this was lunch time around 12pm. it opens at 10am. i can't rate the food because i never got any. needless to say i won't be back EVER! read the reviews! service is poor. walk across the parking lot to the other side of hong kong market you'll get good clean healthy food and good service and you won't be asked TO COME BACK LATER!

ProviderLocation: 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston , TX 77060 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston, TX 77060
ReviewText: I typically don't review chain restaurants like these but sometimes there is something that just stands out. ProviderLocation: 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston , TX 77060 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston, TX 77060

ProviderLocation: 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston , TX 77060 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston, TX 77060
ReviewText: I happened to be staying nearby and there aren't many food choices. In fact this is the only place other than fast food near where I was. That can be a coin toss. Well this time I got it right. Typical diner style but atmosphere more like a small town than a metropolitan area. The staff was super friendly and if there's a definition of Southern Hospitality, this is it. The food was good and I would definitely go back.

ProviderLocation: 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston , TX 77060 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston, TX 77060
ReviewText: Waffle House is diner dinning in all its glory. It's not flashy, nor classy and doesn't even pretend to be. Friendly and chatty staff. Eclectic and intriguing customers. And good greasy diner favourites. Love their hash browns when you load it up. Come for dinner and a show and you won't be disappointed. A naughty secret indulgence whenever I am in Texas. Love it.

ProviderLocation: 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston , TX 77060 728 N Sam Houston E , Houston, TX 77060
ReviewText: Stopped for a quick lunch this past week. Ordered the chicken salad. The chicken was good and flavorful. The salad was wilted and inedible. I scooped it out of my bowl onto the counter and not once did the wait staff look or inquire if my food was OK. After paying full price for an inedible salad I informed the cashier they should be ashamed to sell food in such a condition. She agreed but did not offer me a discount. If you're wondering, I did clean the counter and put the tainted veggies back in my bowl before departing. Not recommended.

ReviewText: I took a friend there for dinner. The wait staff was terrific. The restaurant had a comfortable feel. There was a great variety of choices. We had one chicken and one seafood dish. The food was great. Additionally, my date loved the presentation. It is obvious they take time with each entrée. That said, the price was extremely reasonable. I will go back!

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: I'm not a seafood person but went to this restaurant with a group of friends. The atmosphere was good. Waitstaff was awesome. I ordered the shrimp and grits and the dish was excellent. The other people in our party also raved about their food. Splurged and ordered a desert...the white chocolate bread pudding was awesome. Definitely recommend this place.

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: It breaks my heart to write this review because this place came highly recommended by other business owners in the community and we were so excited to dine. In route, we used trip advisor to read the reviews and view directions. Online business hours were written as 11:00am - 9:00pm on Sunday. We arrived at approximately 1:45pm and decided to sit at the sushi bar. We were greeted by our waitress. We decided to order a bottle of wine and start with appetizers. We informed our waitress we'd be enjoying many items on the menu to which she replied "No problem." After our appetizers arrived, we asked for a few moments to select an entree. Our waitress came back and asked in a strong tone "Are y'all going to order anything else?" At this point I thought maybe she's supposed to be off now. I responded, "Is it time for you to be off?" She told us yes it was. I asked if she could transfer us to another table so we could order without causing her to stay late to which she replied "Sure." Two minutes later, she came back and informed us we would have to leave because guests aren't allowed to eat after 3pm because the chef takes a break. I asked to speak with a manager. He came over and stated yes we would have to leave. Keep in mind we had and entire bottle of wine we had not consumed. I then explained we were first time guests and we were not aware guests couldn't eat or would be refused service at 3pm sharp. I also informed him #TripAdvisor shows hours of operation from 11AM - 9PM, to which he replied "That doesn't matter." We paid our tab of $58.22 and left a tip to make a point! It was the most disappointing heartbreaking experience ever! I can't believe this actually happened.
ReviewTitle: They ruined our experience as First time guests!

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: We use to frequent the location in Cypress and miss it terribly. This is the 3rd time we have been to the 249 location and finally got a table upstairs. I had heard it was nicer and it really is. I had the ocean smokehouse. The salad with the ginger sesame dressing was really good but my main dish.. was amazing. I had gotten the ocean smokehouse before and I remember liking it but it was amazing tonight. I was in love with my dinner from the first bite. I don't mind paying $20 for a meal when it is that good. Hubby had blacked redfish and enjoyed it too. Thank you for the amazing food.

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: This is one of my favorite sushi places. Always compare other sushi places to Red Fish. Great rolls, great sauces. Happy to add/remove ingredients if you ask. Usually eat there a few times a month.

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: Went to Redfish from a personal recommendation. Found out they had seafood cocktail (ceviche) and got excited. It was good but too heavy with a ketchup taste. Nice pieces of shrimp and fish though. Had the shrimp and lump crab bake and it was really good. It comes out very hot so be careful.

ProviderLocation: 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston , TX 77070-3002 19550 State Highway 249 , Houston, TX 77070-3002
ReviewText: We turned up on a Friday lunchtime: the staff were struggling to place 10 people - seemed very disorganised. Ordered an appetiser and drinks - they came quickly. The entrees arrived 15 minutes later: I ordered grilled fish and Asian julienne vegetables. The dish came with a champagne sauce - but rather than being subtle, they completely covered the veg - so a healthy meal became unhealthy very quickly. In addition, the rice arrived after the entrée was served - only a minute, but no rationale why it was delayed (after all, a cup of rice isn't so difficult to serve). The waitress was great and replaced my tea after a fly decided to take a drink.... Cleanliness was average - watching them clean tables was simply moving the crumbs around...odd.
ReviewTitle: Excellent fish - let down by over-dressing

ReviewTitle: I knew better before I did it

ProviderLocation: 13145 Northwest Fwy , Houston , TX 77040-6307 13145 Northwest Fwy , Houston, TX 77040-6307
ReviewText: I have gone to Golden Corrals for years and this was at the bottom of the list. Half of the food was empty and the rest didn't look overly yummy. There was no desert except for a couple rice crispy bars even though the girl was baking carrot cake then frosting it and then put it away. When a customer asked her a question she said she didn't know english. The staff were very unfriendly and never came to the table except to bring the first soda. I would recommend to drive on by.

ProviderLocation: 13145 Northwest Fwy , Houston , TX 77040-6307 13145 Northwest Fwy , Houston, TX 77040-6307
ReviewText: I have not eaten at one of these eateries in six years, and I won't eat here again. It's obvious that they are priced to suit many pockets, but the quality is not in the food. Sure if you like this smorgasbord of a selection, so be it. I found the pot roast to be rather bland, the ribs were rather tasteless, the deserts were quite honestly awful. Okay you can't go much wrong with ice cream, but the hot deserts, well I left each one I tried, the pastry sucks, the fruit was horrible. However, the place was pretty full, maybe because you pay a fixed price, maybe because you pay in advance so not necessary to tip staff. Maybe because you can stuff your face with endless trips to the food trays. My table was dirty before I sat down and twenty minutes later as I had decided enough was enough, that it was finally cleaned of bits of food from the previous guest. I won't be back again.

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: Have eaten at this restaurant several times and found it to be consistently very good. The service is always good. Wait time is short because of size.
ReviewTitle: Great food great atmosphere great restaurant. Wait time is short because of size.

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: Enjoyed this local Memorial City food spot on a Saturday afternoon. Busier than anticipated although connection with the hostess was efficiently managed by text message and seating was assigned after enjoying the beginning of red wine from a very limited wine list. Options for a hearty cab are limited but acceptable. The booth service was quite enjoyable with efficient delivery of a wedge salad starter (generously presented) and a shared entree of Grilled Costa Rican Mahi slathered with shrimp and crabmeat over a bed of butternut squash. Although the sauce was delicious,you came away with a feeling that you had just consumed your annual allowable intake of butter with this succulent presentation. Bravo to the culinary team, for bringing a real winner to the menu. And for us we were adequately impressed with the attentive but not "hovering" service in a very, very busy food outlet. You may be surprised with the level of casual dining chatter "noise" but sometimes that ambience accompanies popular eateries with hard surfaces everywhere. Part of the appeal I suppose, but give this place a 5 star for this experience.
ReviewTitle: Another example of Pappas' attention to detail & exceptional service.

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: My wife and I travel to galveston from Dallas every summer,pappadeaux is a fun place to eat and the food is great we will always come back on our way to galveston I give it a thumbs up!!

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: I decided to try something different and ordered the Shrimp Creole and was not disappointed. Wife had the fried shrimp. I really liked the creole, it was served with some grits which found unusual but very good (grits more common further east). I live "shrimp and grits" and this creole and grits was a winner too. Next time I'm in Houston, I'll probably stop here and order the same thing again. Service was perfect. Pricey but you get what you pay for.

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: I heard lots of things about Papadeaux's, some ok some not so good. Well while staying in North Houston I and my wife decided to eat there. Boy were we surprised. Food was well seasoned, which being from Louisiana, we absolutely Loved. the portion was well rounded being that Im a big guy, I was very full. I personally suggest that anyone staying in North Houston, who loves cajun food, to eat here.

ProviderLocation: 10449 IH 10 , Houston , TX 10449 IH 10 , Houston, TX
ReviewText: The Memorial City location is great. Been going there for 15 years. The crawfish platter is amazing and a ton of food. If you want a taste of Cajun while in Houston, this is a great place.

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192
ReviewText: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful meal here last weekend. We wanted a light dinner and decided to try it. We started with the calamari and my husband absolutely loved it. We both had the glass wall salad which was wonderful and a side of Brussel sprouts. Our waiter was really nice and accommodating. My husband doesn't eat dart so he switch the ice cream for sorbet. The chocolate cake with blood orange sorbet was my favorite! Make reservations , we did not and sat outside which was a little chilly. Also you have to valet your car which is complimentary

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192
ReviewText: We went here based on the reviews online. What a wonderful experience. We were greeted by Eric. He sat us promptly and was extremely attentive as our waiter. He gave great food recommendations. The food was awesome. We had the lobster dip. Then my husband had the seafood paella and I had a huge perfectly cooked pork chop. We also ordered the roasted Brussel sprouts. It was all delicious. It was way too much food to eat it all but we we enjoyed every bite and brought home lots of leftovers. The restaurant was also spacious and lovely. Even the valet was attentive and extremely friendly. What a terrific evening. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192
ReviewText: Our first visit to Glass Wall was during Houston Restaurant Weeks on a very busy Saturday night - dinner was excellent. We had the alaskan salmon and the chicken fried steak, with bread pudding to follow - really tasty. The full menu looks very enticing, so we will be back. Service was very good at first, but as the restaurant was busy, we sometimes found it difficult to get a hold of our waiter for our next round of drinks. This is was a pretty noisy place, it was a wee bit hard to hear the conversation round the table. But all in all, we enjoyed the visit.
ReviewTitle: Good Food in great Neighborhood Restaurant

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192

It appears valet is the only parking option which was good for us since it was pouring rain! It's also a beautiful interior. Will definitely return to try other menu items!

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192
ReviewText: I have always enjoyed Glass Wall. The menu is diverse and unique. I was disappointed last time I went that they had a smoking section outside, so when the door opened all the smoke entered...we were by that door.

ProviderLocation: 933 Studewood St , Houston , TX 77008-7192 933 Studewood St , Houston, TX 77008-7192
ReviewText: There are many great things about living in the Heights, but one of them is most definitely great local restaurants. The Glass Wall is no exception. They just refreshed their menu for 2014 as well as their wine list. Food and service are consistently good and this is a great place for a date night or dinner with friends.

ProviderLocation: 1151 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3232 1151 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3232
ReviewText: We recently returned to the Uptown Park McCormick and Schmick's for dinner. I remember this as being a reliably good seafood restaurant, with a variety of fresh fish brought in daily, prepared to order, and served with fresh veggies. Service was always good. However, based on recent visit, things have changed for the worse. To start, the service was VERY slow; it took 30minutes to get our orders in and drinks served, even though the restaurant was not that busy. In terms of the food, I ordered the parmesan encrusted flounder, but it came pan fried and very greasy. Sides included green beans, which were also very oily; the mashed potatoes did not seem like real potatoes, but were rather like the instant variety. We also ordered a grilled redfish, but it was tasteless--like it had been frozen. Finally, the bill was high considering the quality of the food. We won't be going back here soon. I remember this as a great seafood restaurant, but times change.
ReviewTitle: Times change: a reliably good seafood restaurant turns into disappointing

ProviderLocation: 1151 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3232 1151 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3232
ReviewText: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and I took her there for dinner. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was impeccable. We both thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious meal with a very nice atmosphere. I have eaten at these restaurants several times, and never had a bad experience. The parking was quite convenient to the restaurant.

ReviewText: First of all thank you chefs...if you like tradition, but modern fine dining high ceilings,booths with curtains, lit glass statues, and a lit candle at the table, right in the gallera area, with amazing seafood and steaks, quiet relaxed wooded rooms, but casual dress comfortable, than forget the old owners as landrys has taken over, and it is an open kitchen. No burnt edges of bread, just perfect preparation, and great lobster bisque. Salads yes, and steaks and wonderful desserts. As nice as any 4 star hotel, romantic or alone, the manager shines and keeps a clean refreshing kitchen. No longer a fan of royal sonesta, and ignore my previous review on it, get to eat here for seafood and relaxing fare.I can not say enough, and it is so much better than willie g's. Forget the rest when visiting in the galleria area. This was a fabulous experience. Find them hiding off 610...and get ready to smile at fresh fish and more...then see you at the rodeo!

ReviewText: I stayed at the Hilton Westchase next door, and Forno's was recommended by a front desk staff member as one of the best Italian places in the area. I went around 6 PM for an early dinner and was quite disappointed. Upon arrival I was promptly seated and my order was taken. I ordered the lasagna which arrived quickly. ProviderLocation: 5305 Antoine Dr , Houston , TX 77091-4909 5305 Antoine Dr , Houston, TX 77091-4909
ReviewText: Growing up in Texas, you learn the difference in Mexican food and Tex-Mex. Most people probably don't know the difference, but just like Chinese people don't eat fortune cookies, Mexicans don't eat fajitas, except in Tex-Mex restaurants in Mexico. But in Texas, Tex-Mex is fine art. Some may judge a Tex-Mex restaurant on the strength of its margaritas, but anyone who knows anything about Tex-Mex cuisine, knows to judge the restaurant on the strength of their borracho beans. At Don Jose, both are top shelf. Ignore the Nixon-era decor, and be sure to ask for the tomatillo sauce. Definitely try the Charcoal Chicken Enchiladas. The only thing better than the food is the service. Know your drinks will be refilled before you need to ask, no matter what you're drinking. The staff is friendly, the food is fabulous and you'll be planning a return visit before you get the check.
ReviewTitle: If you like Tex-Mex, try Don Jose

ProviderLocation: 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston , TX 77027-4717 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston, TX 77027-4717
ReviewText: We eat out in Houston a LOT. I should have reviewed Grotto a million times over, but I guess I eat here so often that I don't take the time to review. So, here is the 20 year overdue review. Grotto is awesome. We probably eat here once/week, and know most of the waiters by name. Grotto is a place where you can enjoy consistently fabulous food at lunch, dinner, brunch, anytime and always get a great meal. It's hard to review because everything we eat here is delicious. It's hard to go wrong when you could make a meal off the bread basket. Never ending bread is a gluten feast you don't want to miss. At lunchtime, we usually get the Business lunch special. It's a great value and more food than you could hope to eat. Get the Grotto salad, but try it with the Gorgonzola dressing. That's my favorite salad there. The pastas, fish, chicken, soups, appetizers, it's all always great. I love the Chicken Scallopini, and I've never had a bad fish dish here. Chicken and spinach canneloni (what I had today) is always decadent and fabulous. Also, drink the apricot tea. It goes with everything - especially at lunch when wine is not an option for those going back to work. Don't miss the chocolate cake. I bake, and my chocolate cake is fabulous. That makes it really hard to eat chocolate cake anywhere else. This is the one I'll make an exception for, and the yummy business lunch now includes a junior version of it! Happy day! The patio is also great this time of year. I love the olive trees and right now, when it's 70's in Houston, you can't beat them for a great outdoor dining adventure. The service is always consistently excellent. Attentive, friendly and never obtrusive. Most of the waiters have worked here for many, many years, and that shows the great management team at Grotto as well. If you time it right, you'll probably be sitting next to Tilman Fertitta as well - he dines here regularly. Thanks Grotto, for 20+ years of great dining. We'll see you next week!
ReviewTitle: Our go-to place for great food, fun atmosphere and consistently excellent service

ProviderLocation: 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston , TX 77027-4717 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston, TX 77027-4717
ReviewText: This was a second time to eat here and both times were great. We ate out side on the patio and food and service were great. This is a wonderful place for Italian food. A slight improvement could be done with the Grotto salad. I thought it would have more olives and other items to complete the chopped lettuce. Wife and I spilt the salad and I think we both got two very small olives (with the seed). I still think it is worth going to because the quality of the dishes are so good. The artisan crested bread with dipping sauce that comes when you sit down is so good. Dinning inside or on the patio, I think you will be happy you chose this place.

ProviderLocation: 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston , TX 77027-4717 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston, TX 77027-4717
ReviewText: I went to the one in downtown location. Very nice atmosphere inside. Service was good and quick. I had very nice soup and see food. I have no hesitation to recommend. If I will come back to Houston, I will go back there again.

ProviderLocation: 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston , TX 77027-4717 4715 Westheimer Rd , Houston, TX 77027-4717

ReviewText: We went to Massa's before a concert downtown. We had an outstanding meal for the price range and had wonderful service from the waitstaff and Owners of the restaurant. I will definitely look forward to going back. I highly recommend the Shrimp and Grits. Perfect.
ReviewTitle: Excellent food + Great Service = Excellent Experience

ProviderLocation: 1331 Lamar St , Houston , TX 77010-3025 1331 Lamar St , Houston, TX 77010-3025
ReviewText: We went here before a concert at the Toyota Center. It is directly in front of the Four Seasons and has great parking and is easily accessible for a downtown restaurant. I really liked the family run business atmosphere, not filled with illegals like many of the non-chain choices. Variety of bread choices including corn bread muffins with herb butter were yummy especially just out of the oven. We enjoyed the crab cakes. Definitely fresh seafood. I normally don't comment on cocktails but I liked the Texas tini. My husband had the lobster special and practically licked the plate. They had great southern dessert options like peach cobbler but I was too full so I opted for an espresso which luckily they had at dinner. The service was good. The timing of the meals came out perfectly, having time to finish my appetizer is important to me. I don't often give this high of a rating but for the price, this place was exceptional. The bathrooms were nice with hand lotion and nice soap, for me when you get the thoughtful extras and have great prices, you deserve a top rating.

ProviderLocation: 1331 Lamar St , Houston , TX 77010-3025 1331 Lamar St , Houston, TX 77010-3025
ReviewText: Massa's has a nice table layout, enough space between each other. My shrimp & grits entree was good. The house appetizer for two is nice (crab cakes are good), just one comment: don't put the hot and sour sauce for the fried / stuffed shrimp in a small plastic container, serve it in a small ceramic bowl. Also the service is to fast, you are hardly sitting, and still trying to understand the drink specials and they come by and ask what to drink and want to have an appetizer. Dining at a place as Massa's should be a social experience not a fast food in and out (turning tables) experience.

ProviderLocation: 1331 Lamar St , Houston , TX 77010-3025 1331 Lamar St , Houston, TX 77010-3025

ReviewText: The favorite was the dessert! Although we enjoyed the salads and appetizers as well as the steaks we loved the desserts! Not too impressed with our waiter who seemed a little "pushy". Overall we liked it and will probably try it again.

ProviderLocation: 947 Gessner Rd , Houston , TX 77024-2516 947 Gessner Rd , Houston, TX 77024-2516
ReviewText: Wife and I came for Houston restaurant week's, and had a very pleasant experience. Unfortunately, the restaurant is not very full, as it has not caught on yet, still new to the Memorial area. We've been here several times, and the service is hit or miss. I noticed most of the waiters from our last visit were not working. We got an older waiter, interested in pushing drinks as seems to be the norm in Houston these days. Aside from that, the food quality was above average, and very good for the area. But if you have the time, make the trip to Pappas Bros steakhouse. It's about the same price, and way better.

ProviderLocation: 947 Gessner Rd , Houston , TX 77024-2516 947 Gessner Rd , Houston, TX 77024-2516
ReviewText: The 4 of us dined at Vallone's on the HRW menu. I started with the mini ahi tuna tacos. They were tasty. I had a bite of the corn raviolini and it was fantastic. I then had the summer salad which was fine. My husband had the quail which was pretty good. Next up was the roasted salmon which was cooked nicely although not quite as raw as I had ordered. The sauce under it was not a winner. The tomato reduction was too similar to Campbell's tomato soup - cloying and lacking in fresh flavor. My husband loved his choice of The Tex - two enchiladas and a center cut filet. I ended the meal with the midnight cake which was decadent and oh so chocolate-y. We sat in a booth and although the restaurant filled up, we could easily have a conversation amongst the 4 of us. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. He offered to do a tasting of 3 wines to help me choose one I'd like. He forgot to charge us for a bottle of wine and was very grateful when we pointed it out. We'll be back.

ProviderLocation: 2604 Dunlavy St , Houston , TX 77006-3702 2604 Dunlavy St , Houston, TX 77006-3702
ReviewText: I really appreciated all of the healthy options, as well as the gluten free alternative, since I have celiac disease. It was hard to pick from the menu because everything looked so good. My dining partner got one chicken and one black bean & kale tamale, and both were goos, but the chicken tamale was especially good. I got the black bean burger with lettuce instead of bread with a side house salad, which comes with spring greens, radicchio, blue cheese, and walnuts. The food was great, but i took off one star because the people at the front counter were pretty obnoxious. They called us over to order even though we hadn't decided yet, and then became very impatient when we didn't have an order right away. The loud singing from the cashier while we ordered was pretty awkward and unprofessional.

ReviewText: The restaurant is a counter service style and for the apparent size of the restaurant has a ton of seating inside plus much of it out doors on a front patio and back courtyard. ProviderLocation: 2604 Dunlavy St , Houston , TX 77006-3702 2604 Dunlavy St , Houston, TX 77006-3702
ReviewText: Parking can be difficult. Assuming you find a spot, be ready to order at counter once inside. Menus are to the left of the counter...drink menu and food menu located together. ReviewTitle: Great salad and coffee... ok burgers

ProviderLocation: 720 Fannin St , Houston , TX 77002-3408 720 Fannin St , Houston, TX 77002-3408
ReviewText: My husband & I stayed in Club Quarter Hotel for 3 nights. Table 7 Bistro was convienently located downstairs. We ate at the Bistro for breakfast & it was so great we had to come back. 1st morning we ordered the French Toast plate which is accompanied by eggs + bacon or sauage + country potatoe. Also the torilla eggs which was tasty both around $12 each. 2nd morning we shared the pancake plate & bagel which we enjoyed. Should I come back to Houston & stay @ Club Quarters I would definately eat here again.

ProviderLocation: 720 Fannin St , Houston , TX 77002-3408 720 Fannin St , Houston, TX 77002-3408
ReviewText: Tried out this place before a concert downtown during houston restaurant weeks. I figured if something was part of houston restaurant weeks, it meant it was good, because never before have I had something bad on HRW, but I was wrong! 1st, we were the only people there for dinner. There were 2 people at the bar, and then us. Asked for the wine list. Waiter said "were still working on making one." That should have been a red flag. The waiter then began listing the kinds of wines to me: pino grigio, chardonnay... but no brands or prices. I just went with "the house." My husband asked for jim beam, they didn't have it. He then asked for michelob, they didn't have it. He then asked for whatever whiskey simular to jim beam they had. The waiter said he would ask the bartender for his recommendation. The waiter then walked behind the bar and poured the drink himself. The boys got the flat bread appetizer. It was plain pita bread out of a package with a smidge of Parmesan shreds on top. I got the spinach salad, it was boring and flavorless. My friend got the shrimp, which she said was good. 3 of us got the steak, one the pork chop. I ordered my steak medium-well, it was beyond well-done, dry, and no seasoning or flavor whatsoever. My husband got his steak medium-rare. It was inedible it was so rare. I mean it was disgusting how raw it was. The sides were boring steamed vegetables and flavorless mashed potatoes. Very disappointed. The only thing I enjoyed was the dessert. I had the creme brule. It was delicious. The boys had the bread pudding, which they both enjoyed. And my friend had the chocolate cake, which was also good. Overall this place was disappointing.

ProviderLocation: 720 Fannin St , Houston , TX 77002-3408 720 Fannin St , Houston, TX 77002-3408
ReviewText: We stayed at Club Quarters over a weekend and reluctantly tried this place for breakfast as it seemed to be the only option open early. We were really pleasantly surprised. They have a great menu, friendly staff and the food was both reasonably priced and delicious. We ate here twice and came in for some drinks one evening and enjoyed it every time. I didn't give five stars because the restroom is a bit dirty and could use a revamp.

ProviderLocation: 720 Fannin St , Houston , TX 77002-3408 720 Fannin St , Houston, TX 77002-3408
ReviewText: We had Favor deliver a meal from this restaurant and it was horrible! The Panko chicken bowl included an over cooked frozen chicken slab that was supposed to resemble a breast we assume... The pasta is something that would be served at Golden Corral. The pork chop was tough and the roasted potatoes and the Brussels sprouts were inedible. I asked that the veggies be placed in separate container, but that did not happen... resulting in the juice from the sprouts soaking everything else. I usually give restaurants 3 times before I give up on them... this restaurant does not get another chance.

ProviderLocation: 720 Fannin St , Houston , TX 77002-3408 720 Fannin St , Houston, TX 77002-3408
